    Analysing subscales of the HoNOS

    honos_subscales.Rmd
    library(honos)
#> This is honos 0.1.1
#> honos is currently in development -function names and arguments might change.
#> PLEASE REPORT ANY BUGS!

    Introduction

    Review the psychometric literature on this topic, e.g., Trauer (1999)

    How to calculate subscales

    Return long format

    
honos_long %>% 
  honos::calc_subscales(id_var = id, 
                        date_var = date, 
                        item_var = item, 
                        value_var = value, 
                        return_format = "long", 
                        return_items = TRUE)
#> Note: This is using the subscales as identified in ... TODO ADD REFERNCE (YEAR).
#> # A tibble: 39,000 x 7
#>    id    date       measure item  value honos_subscale honos_subscale_value
#>    <fct> <date>     <chr>   <fct> <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>
#>  1 id1   2018-08-05 honos   1         2 behaviour                         8
#>  2 id1   2018-08-05 honos   2         4 behaviour                         8
#>  3 id1   2018-08-05 honos   3         2 behaviour                         8
#>  4 id1   2018-08-05 honos   4         3 impairment                        5
#>  5 id1   2018-08-05 honos   5         2 impairment                        5
#>  6 id1   2018-08-05 honos   6        NA symptom                          NA
#>  7 id1   2018-08-05 honos   7         1 symptom                          NA
#>  8 id1   2018-08-05 honos   8         0 symptom                          NA
#>  9 id1   2018-08-05 honos   9         1 social                            9
#> 10 id1   2018-08-05 honos   10        3 social                            9
#> # … with 38,990 more rows

    Return wide format

    
honos_long %>% 
  honos::calc_subscales(id_var = id, 
                        date_var = date, 
                        item_var = item, 
                        value_var = value, 
                        return_format = "wide", 
                        return_items = FALSE)
#> Note: This is using the subscales as identified in ... TODO ADD REFERNCE (YEAR).
#> # A tibble: 3,000 x 7
#>    id    date       measure honos_behaviour honos_impairment honos_symptom
#>    <fct> <date>     <chr>             <dbl>            <dbl>         <dbl>
#>  1 id1   2018-08-05 honos                 8                5            NA
#>  2 id1   2015-10-31 honos                NA                5             8
#>  3 id1   2009-09-23 honos                 7                1             5
#>  4 id2   2019-06-13 honos                 4                3             8
#>  5 id2   2019-06-10 honos                 6                3             7
#>  6 id2   2003-08-06 honos                 6               NA             8
#>  7 id3   2019-12-17 honos                 9                6            10
#>  8 id3   2016-04-17 honos                 1               NA            12
#>  9 id3   2010-02-13 honos                NA                4             4
#> 10 id4   2019-05-01 honos                 9                8            11
#> # … with 2,990 more rows, and 1 more variable: honos_social <dbl>

    References

    Trauer, Thomas. 1999. “The Subscale Structure of the Health of the Nation Outcome Scales (HoNOS).” Journal of Mental Health 8 (5): 499–509. https://doi.org/10.1080/09638239917193.
